name: Minigrace
tagline: Self-hosting compiler for the Grace programming language
body:
Minigrace
=========
_Minigrace_ is a compiler for the Grace programming language.

Minigrace compiles Grace to native code via C, and to JavaScript. The compiler is written in
Grace itself. It supports most of the specified language to date: for
details on current language feature support see <doc/errata>.

Minigrace should work on POSIX-compliant systems, and is known to work
on Linux, NetBSD, and Mac OS X.  Native code generation requires a properly-configured GCC on
the path, which may require installing development tools.  Running the generated JavaScript requires
that _node.js_ be installed.

Tarball distributions should compile with just `./configure && make`.
More detailed build instructions
are in <doc/build>.

After building there will be a `minigrace` executable in the root directory. This
executable supports a few different modes and options, described in
<doc/usage>. The simplest usage is just:
    ./minigrace file.grace
which will compile _file.grace_ to a native executable and then run it, and
    ./minigrace --target js file.grace
which will _compile file.grace_ to JavaScript and then execute it with node.

The Minigrace documentation is listed in the <doc/index> file.
